headline: Dow Inc. (DOW): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on Dow Inc. on Quipus Capital’s Substack. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on DOW. Dow Inc.’s share was trading at $23.86 as of December 2nd. DOW’s trailing and forward P/E were 32.65 and 13.61 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. Dow Inc. (DOW), restructured after its 2019 de-merger from […]

headline: Albemarle (ALB) Up 30.6% Since Last Earnings Report: Can It Continue?
summary: Albemarle (ALB) reported earnings 30 days ago. What's next for the stock? We take a look at earnings estimates for some clues.

headline: Should Dow’s Dividend Cut And Cash Flow Strain Require Action From Dow (DOW) Investors?
summary: Dow has been caught in an industrywide slump, and in April 2025 it cut its dividend in half after years of underperformance versus the broader market. The dividend reduction underlines how pressured cash flows and weak sector conditions are forcing management to rethink Dow’s long‑standing income appeal. Next, we’ll examine how Dow’s recent dividend cut reshapes its investment narrative built around cost discipline and asset optimization. The end of cancer? These 29 emerging AI stocks are...

headline: Dow: Better To Bet On The Sector, Not The Company
summary: Dow Inc. (DOW) faces persistent cyclical weakness, with declining sales and margins, prompting a downgrade to Hold from Buy.

raw.headline: Dow: Better To Bet On The Sector, Not The Company

headline: Is Dow A Bargain Or A Trap After Its 42% Slide In 2025?
summary: Wondering if Dow is a deep value opportunity or a value trap at today’s price? Let us unpack what the market is really paying for and whether that lines up with the company’s fundamentals. Over the last week the stock has slipped about 4.3%, but over the past month it is still up around 1.2%, after a tough year where shares are down roughly 42.2% year to date and 41.7% over the last 12 months. Those moves come against a backdrop of ongoing macro uncertainty hitting cyclical, materials...
